answers.answer: The probability of one false negative HIV tests is ridiculously low. (like, 0.7% chance of being a false negative.)it is even more ridiculously, astronomically unlikely that the second one would also be a false negative.
I think 3 months is now considered conclusive. Is this correct?
3 Months has been the official and conclusive Hiv window period since 2004.Put this matter behind you now.
At no time were you ever at risk of contracting HIV.
her having diabetes will not affect the hiv test result

question: hi,I am a lesbian in my mid 20's. I have been in a mongamous relationship with a girl for 3 years. about 4 months ago, she cheated on me with a man. She has had two HIV tests at my request. 1 month blood test and at three months, oral swab test. Both negative. We have had sexual contact since the tests. oral sex, and grinding. she has type 1 diabetes. Could this affect the tests accuracy? Am i at risk? I am worrying far too much. Tonight her face broke out into a sudden rash. she tested her blood sugar and it was 600. could this cause the rash? i 'm worried.
title: phobia? or real risk?
